MS MCQs

    Identify governing practices for responsible AI in government

    »

    1. Why is it important to involve many different stakeholders in discussions regarding responsible AI in government?

      AI is a very controversial technology, so it’s important to include many perspectives when discussing it.

      AI is a very complicated technology, so it requires many experts to inform discussions regarding its regulation.

      AI is an emergent technology and it’s being implemented in new ways. Because it’s self-learning and autonomous, AI requires careful oversight and input from many different experts.

      AI is an emergent technology, so there are very few established best practices for implementing it in government scenarios, requiring input from many different experts.


    2. Why should governments customize their responsible AI governance model?

      Governments should tailor their responsible AI governance model to reflect their national priorities and culture.

      Governments should tailor their responsible AI governance model to reflect the needs of their biggest businesses.

      Governments should tailor their responsible AI governance model to reflect the desires of their leader.

      Governments do not have to tailor their responsible AI governance model, they can simply implement a model used by another nation.


    3. What is the key advantage of a hybrid governance model?

      A hybrid governance model ensures all agencies adhere to the same strict guidelines for responsible AI development and deployment.

      A hybrid governance model empowers individual agencies to completely create their own standards and policies.

      A hybrid governance model provides individual agencies with a set of guiding principles to ensure alignment but empowers them to execute on their own projects, enabling rapid innovation.

      A hybrid governance model provides different guidelines to different agencies based on their needs, enabling rapid innovation.


    4. Why is it important for AI policy development to be agile?

      AI policies need to be flexible in order to keep up with the rapidly evolving technology.

      AI policies need to be flexible in order to meet enterprise needs.

      AI policies need to be flexible in order to reflect changes in public opinion.

      AI policies need to be flexible in order to match the policies of governments who are leading in AI.
